00028 /* HSM copytool program for POSIX filesystem-based HSM's.
00029  *
00030  * An HSM copytool daemon acts on action requests from Lustre to copy files
00031  * to and from an HSM archive system. This one in particular makes regular
00032  * POSIX filesystem calls to a given path, where an HSM is presumably mounted.
00033  *
00034  * This particular tool can also import an existing HSM archive.
00035  */
00036 
00037 #ifndef _GNU_SOURCE
00038 #define _GNU_SOURCE
00039 #endif

00063 /* Progress reporting period */
00064 #define REPORT_INTERVAL_DEFAULT 30
00065 /* HSM hash subdir permissions */
00066 #define DIR_PERM S_IRWXU
00067 /* HSM hash file permissions */
00068 #define FILE_PERM (S_IRUSR | S_IWUSR)

00070 #define ONE_MB 0x100000
00071

00073 # define NSEC_PER_SEC 1000000000UL
00074 #endif

00076 enum ct_action {
00077         CA_IMPORT = 1,
00078         CA_REBIND,
00079         CA_MAXSEQ,
00080 };

00082 struct options {
00083         int                      o_copy_attrs;
00084         int                      o_daemonize;
00085         int                      o_dry_run;
00086         int                      o_abort_on_error;
00087         int                      o_shadow_tree;
00088         int                      o_verbose;
00089         int                      o_copy_xattrs;
00090         int                      o_archive_cnt;
00091         int                      o_archive_id[LL_HSM_MAX_ARCHIVE];
00092         int                      o_report_int;
00093         unsigned long long       o_bandwidth;
00094         size_t                   o_chunk_size;
00095         enum ct_action           o_action;
00096         char                    *o_event_fifo;
00097         char                    *o_mnt;
00098         int                      o_mnt_fd;
00099         char                    *o_hsm_root;
00100         char                    *o_src; /* for import, or rebind */
00101         char                    *o_dst; /* for import, or rebind */
00102 };
00103 
00104 /* everything else is zeroed */
00105 struct options opt = {
00106         .o_copy_attrs = 1,
00107         .o_shadow_tree = 1,
00108         .o_verbose = LLAPI_MSG_INFO,
00109         .o_copy_xattrs = 1,
00110         .o_report_int = REPORT_INTERVAL_DEFAULT,
00111         .o_chunk_size = ONE_MB,
00112 };

00114 /* hsm_copytool_private will hold an open FD on the lustre mount point
00115  * for us. Additionally open one on the archive FS root to make sure
00116  * it doesn't drop out from under us (and remind the admin to shutdown
00117  * the copytool before unmounting). */
00118

00129 static inline double ct_now(void)
00130 {
00131         struct timeval tv;
00132 
00133         gettimeofday(&tv, NULL);
00134 
00135         return tv.tv_sec + 0.000001 * tv.tv_usec;
00136 }
00137 
00138 #define CT_ERROR(_rc, _format, ...)                                     \
00139         llapi_error(LLAPI_MSG_ERROR, _rc,                               \
00140                     "%f %s[%ld]: "_format,                              \
00141                     ct_now(), cmd_name, syscall(SYS_gettid), ## __VA_ARGS__)
00142 
00143 #define CT_DEBUG(_format, ...)                                          \
00144         llapi_error(LLAPI_MSG_DEBUG | LLAPI_MSG_NO_ERRNO, 0,            \
00145                     "%f %s[%ld]: "_format,                              \
00146                     ct_now(), cmd_name, syscall(SYS_gettid), ## __VA_ARGS__)
00147 
00148 #define CT_WARN(_format, ...) \
00149         llapi_error(LLAPI_MSG_WARN | LLAPI_MSG_NO_ERRNO, 0,             \
00150                     "%f %s[%ld]: "_format,                              \
00151                     ct_now(), cmd_name, syscall(SYS_gettid), ## __VA_ARGS__)
00152 
00153 #define CT_TRACE(_format, ...)                                          \
00154         llapi_error(LLAPI_MSG_INFO | LLAPI_MSG_NO_ERRNO, 0,             \
00155                     "%f %s[%ld]: "_format,                              \
00156                     ct_now(), cmd_name, syscall(SYS_gettid), ## __VA_ARGS__)

00158 static void usage(const char *name, int rc)
00159 {
00160         fprintf(stdout,
00161         " Usage: %s [options]... <mode> <lustre_mount_point>\n"
00162         "The Lustre HSM Posix copy tool can be used as a daemon or "
00163         "as a command line tool\n"
00164         "The Lustre HSM daemon acts on action requests from Lustre\n"
00165         "to copy files to and from an HSM archive system.\n"
00166         "This POSIX-flavored daemon makes regular POSIX filesystem calls\n"
00167         "to an HSM mounted at a given hsm_root.\n"
00168         "   --daemon            Daemon mode, run in background\n"
00169         " Options:\n"
00170         "   --no-attr           Don't copy file attributes\n"
00171         "   --no-shadow         Don't create shadow namespace in archive\n"
00172         "   --no-xattr          Don't copy file extended attributes\n"
00173         "The Lustre HSM tool performs administrator-type actions\n"
00174         "on a Lustre HSM archive.\n"
00175         "This POSIX-flavored tool can link an existing HSM namespace\n"
00176         "into a Lustre filesystem.\n"
00177         " Usage:\n"
00178         "   %s [options] --import <src> <dst> <lustre_mount_point>\n"
00179         "      import an archived subtree from\n"
00180         "       <src> (FID or relative path to hsm_root) into the Lustre\n"
00181         "             filesystem at\n"
00182         "       <dst> (absolute path)\n"
00183         "   %s [options] --rebind <old_FID> <new_FID> <lustre_mount_point>\n"
00184         "      rebind an entry in the HSM to a new FID\n"
00185         "       <old_FID> old FID the HSM entry is bound to\n"
00186         "       <new_FID> new FID to bind the HSM entry to\n"
00187         "   %s [options] --rebind <list_file> <lustre_mount_point>\n"
00188         "      perform the rebind operation for all FID in the list file\n"
00189         "       each line of <list_file> consists of <old_FID> <new_FID>\n"
00190         "   %s [options] --max-sequence <fsname>\n"
00191         "       return the max fid sequence of archived files\n"
00192         "   --abort-on-error          Abort operation on major error\n"
00193         "   -A, --archive <#>         Archive number (repeatable)\n"
00194         "   -b, --bandwidth <bw>      Limit I/O bandwidth (unit can be used\n,"
00195         "                             default is MB)\n"
00196         "   --dry-run                 Don't run, just show what would be done\n"
00197         "   -c, --chunk-size <sz>     I/O size used during data copy\n"
00198         "                             (unit can be used, default is MB)\n"
00199         "   -f, --event-fifo <path>   Write events stream to fifo\n"
00200         "   -p, --hsm-root <path>     Target HSM mount point\n"
00201         "   -q, --quiet               Produce less verbose output\n"
00202         "   -u, --update-interval <s> Interval between progress reports sent\n"
00203         "                             to Coordinator\n"
00204         "   -v, --verbose             Produce more verbose output\n",
00205         cmd_name, cmd_name, cmd_name, cmd_name, cmd_name);
00206 
00207         exit(rc);
00208 }
00209 
00210 static int ct_parseopts(int argc, char * const *argv)
00211 {
00212         struct option long_opts[] = {
00213                 {"abort-on-error", no_argument,       &opt.o_abort_on_error, 1},
00214                 {"abort_on_error", no_argument,       &opt.o_abort_on_error, 1},
00215                 {"archive",        required_argument, NULL,                'A'},
00216                 {"bandwidth",      required_argument, NULL,                'b'},
00217                 {"chunk-size",     required_argument, NULL,                'c'},
00218                 {"chunk_size",     required_argument, NULL,                'c'},
00219                 {"daemon",         no_argument,       &opt.o_daemonize,     1},
00220                 {"event-fifo",     required_argument, NULL,                'f'},
00221                 {"event_fifo",     required_argument, NULL,                'f'},
00222                 {"dry-run",        no_argument,       &opt.o_dry_run,       1},
00223                 {"help",           no_argument,       NULL,                'h'},
00224                 {"hsm-root",       required_argument, NULL,                'p'},
00225                 {"hsm_root",       required_argument, NULL,                'p'},
00226                 {"import",         no_argument,       NULL,                'i'},
00227                 {"max-sequence",   no_argument,       NULL,                'M'},
00228                 {"max_sequence",   no_argument,       NULL,                'M'},
00229                 {"no-attr",        no_argument,       &opt.o_copy_attrs,    0},
00230                 {"no_attr",        no_argument,       &opt.o_copy_attrs,    0},
00231                 {"no-shadow",      no_argument,       &opt.o_shadow_tree,   0},
00232                 {"no_shadow",      no_argument,       &opt.o_shadow_tree,   0},
00233                 {"no-xattr",       no_argument,       &opt.o_copy_xattrs,   0},
00234                 {"no_xattr",       no_argument,       &opt.o_copy_xattrs,   0},
00235                 {"quiet",          no_argument,       NULL,                'q'},
00236                 {"rebind",         no_argument,       NULL,                'r'},
00237                 {"update-interval", required_argument,  NULL,              'u'},
00238                 {"update_interval", required_argument,  NULL,              'u'},
00239                 {"verbose",        no_argument,       NULL,                'v'},
00240                 {0, 0, 0, 0}
00241         };
00242         int                      c, rc;
00243         unsigned long long       value;
00244         unsigned long long       unit;
00245 
00246         optind = 0;
00247         while ((c = getopt_long(argc, argv, "A:b:c:f:hiMp:qru:v",
00248                                 long_opts, NULL)) != -1) {
00249                 switch (c) {
00250                 case 'A':
00251                         if ((opt.o_archive_cnt >= LL_HSM_MAX_ARCHIVE) ||
00252                             (atoi(optarg) >= LL_HSM_MAX_ARCHIVE)) {
00253                                 rc = -E2BIG;
00254                                 CT_ERROR(rc, "archive number must be less"
00255                                          "than %zu", LL_HSM_MAX_ARCHIVE);
00256                                 return rc;
00257                         }
00258                         opt.o_archive_id[opt.o_archive_cnt] = atoi(optarg);
00259                         opt.o_archive_cnt++;
00260                         break;
00261                 case 'b': /* -b and -c have both a number with unit as arg */
00262                 case 'c':
00263                         unit = ONE_MB;
00264                         if (llapi_parse_size(optarg, &value, &unit, 0) < 0) {
00265                                 rc = -EINVAL;
00266                                 CT_ERROR(rc, "bad value for -%c '%s'", c,
00267                                          optarg);
00268                                 return rc;
00269                         }
00270                         if (c == 'c')
00271                                 opt.o_chunk_size = value;
00272                         else
00273                                 opt.o_bandwidth = value;
00274                         break;
00275                 case 'f':
00276                         opt.o_event_fifo = optarg;
00277                         break;
00278                 case 'h':
00279                         usage(argv[0], 0);
00280                 case 'i':
00281                         opt.o_action = CA_IMPORT;
00282                         break;
00283                 case 'M':
00284                         opt.o_action = CA_MAXSEQ;
00285                         break;
00286                 case 'p':
00287                         opt.o_hsm_root = optarg;
00288                         break;
00289                 case 'q':
00290                         opt.o_verbose--;
00291                         break;
00292                 case 'r':
00293                         opt.o_action = CA_REBIND;
00294                         break;
00295                 case 'u':
00296                         opt.o_report_int = atoi(optarg);
00297                         if (opt.o_report_int < 0) {
00298                                 rc = -EINVAL;
00299                                 CT_ERROR(rc, "bad value for -%c '%s'", c,
00300                                          optarg);
00301                                 return rc;
00302                         }
00303                         break;
00304                 case 'v':
00305                         opt.o_verbose++;
00306                         break;
00307                 case 0:
00308                         break;
00309                 default:
00310                         return -EINVAL;
00311                 }
00312         }
00313 
00314         switch (opt.o_action) {
00315         case CA_IMPORT:
00316                 /* src dst mount_point */
00317                 if (argc != optind + 3) {
00318                         rc = -EINVAL;
00319                         CT_ERROR(rc, "--import requires 2 arguments");
00320                         return rc;
00321                 }
00322                 opt.o_src = argv[optind++];
00323                 opt.o_dst = argv[optind++];
00324                 break;
00325         case CA_REBIND:
00326                 /* FID1 FID2 mount_point or FILE mount_point */
00327                 if (argc == optind + 2) {
00328                         opt.o_src = argv[optind++];
00329                         opt.o_dst = NULL;
00330                 } else if (argc == optind + 3) {
00331                         opt.o_src = argv[optind++];
00332                         opt.o_dst = argv[optind++];
00333                 } else {
00334                         rc = -EINVAL;
00335                         CT_ERROR(rc, "--rebind requires 1 or 2 arguments");
00336                         return rc;
00337                 }
00338                 break;
00339         case CA_MAXSEQ:
00340         default:
00341                 /* just mount point */
00342                 break;
00343         }
00344 
00345         if (argc != optind + 1) {
00346                 rc = -EINVAL;
00347                 CT_ERROR(rc, "no mount point specified");
00348                 return rc;
00349         }
00350 
00351         opt.o_mnt = argv[optind];
00352         opt.o_mnt_fd = -1;
00353 
00354         CT_TRACE("action=%d src=%s dst=%s mount_point=%s",
00355                  opt.o_action, opt.o_src, opt.o_dst, opt.o_mnt);
00356 
00357         if (opt.o_hsm_root == NULL) {
00358                 rc = -EINVAL;
00359                 CT_ERROR(rc, "must specify a root directory for the backend");
00360                 return rc;
00361         }
00362 
00363         if (opt.o_action == CA_IMPORT) {
00364                 if (opt.o_src && opt.o_src[0] == '/') {
00365                         rc = -EINVAL;
00366                         CT_ERROR(rc,
00367                                  "source path must be relative to HSM root");
00368                         return rc;
00369                 }
00370 
00371                 if (opt.o_dst && opt.o_dst[0] != '/') {
00372                         rc = -EINVAL;
00373                         CT_ERROR(rc, "destination path must be absolute");
00374                         return rc;
00375                 }
00376         }
00377 
00378         return 0;
00379 }
00380 
00381 /* mkdir -p path */
00382 static int ct_mkdir_p(const char *path)
00383 {
00384         char    *saved, *ptr;
00385         int      rc;
00386 
00387         ptr = strdup(path);
00388         if (ptr == NULL)
00389                 return -errno;
00390 
00391         saved = ptr;
00392         while (*ptr == '/')
00393                 ptr++;
00394 
00395         while ((ptr = strchr(ptr, '/')) != NULL) {
00396                 *ptr = '\0';
00397                 rc = mkdir(saved, DIR_PERM);
00398                 *ptr = '/';
00399                 if (rc < 0 && errno != EEXIST) {
00400                         rc = -errno;
00401                         CT_ERROR(rc, "cannot mkdir '%s'", path);
00402                         free(saved);
00403                         return rc;
00404                 }
00405                 ptr++;
00406         }
00407 
00408         free(saved);
00409 
00410         return 0;
00411 }
00412 
00413 static int ct_save_stripe(int src_fd, const char *src, const char *dst)
00414 {
00415         char                     lov_file[PATH_MAX];
00416         char                     lov_buf[XATTR_SIZE_MAX];
00417         struct lov_user_md      *lum;
00418         int                      rc;
00419         int                      fd;
00420         ssize_t                  xattr_size;
00421 
00422         snprintf(lov_file, sizeof(lov_file), "%s.lov", dst);
00423         CT_TRACE("saving stripe info of '%s' in %s", src, lov_file);
00424 
00425         xattr_size = fgetxattr(src_fd, XATTR_LUSTRE_LOV, lov_buf,
00426                                sizeof(lov_buf));
00427         if (xattr_size < 0) {
00428                 rc = -errno;
00429                 CT_ERROR(rc, "cannot get stripe info on '%s'", src);
00430                 return rc;
00431         }
00432 
00433         lum = (struct lov_user_md *)lov_buf;
00434 
00435         if (lum->lmm_magic == LOV_USER_MAGIC_V1 ||
00436             lum->lmm_magic == LOV_USER_MAGIC_V3) {
00437                 /* Set stripe_offset to -1 so that it is not interpreted as a
00438                  * hint on restore. */
00439                 lum->lmm_stripe_offset = -1;
00440         }
00441 
00442         fd = open(lov_file, O_TRUNC | O_CREAT | O_WRONLY, FILE_PERM);
00443         if (fd < 0) {
00444                 rc = -errno;
00445                 CT_ERROR(rc, "cannot open '%s'", lov_file);
00446                 goto err_cleanup;
00447         }
00448 
00449         rc = write(fd, lum, xattr_size);
00450         if (rc < 0) {
00451                 rc = -errno;
00452                 CT_ERROR(rc, "cannot write %zd bytes to '%s'",
00453                          xattr_size, lov_file);
00454                 close(fd);
00455                 goto err_cleanup;
00456         }
00457 
00458         rc = close(fd);
00459         if (rc < 0) {
00460                 rc = -errno;
00461                 CT_ERROR(rc, "cannot close '%s'", lov_file);
00462                 goto err_cleanup;
00463         }
00464 
00465         return 0;
00466 
00467 err_cleanup:
00468         unlink(lov_file);
00469 
00470         return rc;
00471 }
00472 
00473 static int ct_load_stripe(const char *src, void *lovea, size_t *lovea_size)
00474 {
00475         char     lov_file[PATH_MAX];
00476         int      rc;
00477         int      fd;
00478 
00479         snprintf(lov_file, sizeof(lov_file), "%s.lov", src);
00480         CT_TRACE("reading stripe rules from '%s' for '%s'", lov_file, src);
00481 
00482         fd = open(lov_file, O_RDONLY);
00483         if (fd < 0) {
00484                 CT_ERROR(errno, "cannot open '%s'", lov_file);
00485                 return -ENODATA;
00486         }
00487 
00488         rc = read(fd, lovea, *lovea_size);
00489         if (rc < 0) {
00490                 CT_ERROR(errno, "cannot read %zu bytes from '%s'",
00491                          *lovea_size, lov_file);
00492                 close(fd);
00493                 return -ENODATA;
00494         }
00495 
00496         *lovea_size = rc;
00497         close(fd);
00498 
00499         return 0;
00500 }
00501 
00502 static int ct_restore_stripe(const char *src, const char *dst, int dst_fd,
00503                              const void *lovea, size_t lovea_size)
00504 {
00505         int     rc;
00506 
00507         rc = fsetxattr(dst_fd, XATTR_LUSTRE_LOV, lovea, lovea_size,
00508                        XATTR_CREATE);
00509         if (rc < 0) {
00510                 rc = -errno;
00511                 CT_ERROR(rc, "cannot set lov EA on '%s'", dst);
00512         }
00513 
00514         return rc;
00515 }
00516 
00517 static int ct_copy_data(struct hsm_copyaction_private *hcp, const char *src,
00518                         const char *dst, int src_fd, int dst_fd,
00519                         const struct hsm_action_item *hai, long hal_flags)
00520 {
00521         struct hsm_extent        he;
00522         __u64                    offset = hai->hai_extent.offset;
00523         struct stat              src_st;
00524         struct stat              dst_st;
00525         char                    *buf = NULL;
00526         __u64                    write_total = 0;
00527         __u64                    length = hai->hai_extent.length;
00528         time_t                   last_report_time;
00529         int                      rc = 0;
00530         double                   start_ct_now = ct_now();
00531         /* Bandwidth Control */
00532         time_t                  start_time;
00533         time_t                  now;
00534         time_t                  last_bw_print;
00535 
00536         if (fstat(src_fd, &src_st) < 0) {
00537                 rc = -errno;
00538                 CT_ERROR(rc, "cannot stat '%s'", src);
00539                 return rc;
00540         }
00541 
00542         if (!S_ISREG(src_st.st_mode)) {
00543                 rc = -EINVAL;
00544                 CT_ERROR(rc, "'%s' is not a regular file", src);
00545                 return rc;
00546         }
00547 
00548         if (hai->hai_extent.offset > (__u64)src_st.st_size) {
00549                 rc = -EINVAL;
00550                 CT_ERROR(rc, "Trying to start reading past end (%ju > "
00551                          "%jd) of '%s' source file",
00552                          (uintmax_t)hai->hai_extent.offset,
00553                          (intmax_t)src_st.st_size, src);
00554                 return rc;
00555         }
00556 
00557         if (fstat(dst_fd, &dst_st) < 0) {
00558                 rc = -errno;
00559                 CT_ERROR(rc, "cannot stat '%s'", dst);
00560                 return rc;
00561         }
00562 
00563         if (!S_ISREG(dst_st.st_mode)) {
00564                 rc = -EINVAL;
00565                 CT_ERROR(rc, "'%s' is not a regular file", dst);
00566                 return rc;
00567         }
00568 
00569         /* Don't read beyond a given extent */
00570         if (length > src_st.st_size - hai->hai_extent.offset)
00571                 length = src_st.st_size - hai->hai_extent.offset;
00572 
00573         start_time = last_bw_print = last_report_time = time(NULL);
00574 
00575         he.offset = offset;
00576         he.length = 0;
00577         rc = llapi_hsm_action_progress(hcp, &he, length, 0);
00578         if (rc < 0) {
00579                 /* Action has been canceled or something wrong
00580                  * is happening. Stop copying data. */
00581                 CT_ERROR(rc, "progress ioctl for copy '%s'->'%s' failed",
00582                          src, dst);
00583                 goto out;
00584         }
00585 
00586         errno = 0;
00587 
00588         buf = malloc(opt.o_chunk_size);
00589         if (buf == NULL) {
00590                 rc = -ENOMEM;
00591                 goto out;
00592         }
00593 
00594         CT_TRACE("start copy of %ju bytes from '%s' to '%s'",
00595                  (uintmax_t)length, src, dst);
00596 
00597         while (write_total < length) {
00598                 ssize_t rsize;
00599                 ssize_t wsize;
00600                 int     chunk = (length - write_total > opt.o_chunk_size) ?
00601                                  opt.o_chunk_size : length - write_total;
00602 
00603                 rsize = pread(src_fd, buf, chunk, offset);
00604                 if (rsize == 0)
00605                         /* EOF */
00606                         break;
00607 
00608                 if (rsize < 0) {
00609                         rc = -errno;
00610                         CT_ERROR(rc, "cannot read from '%s'", src);
00611                         break;
00612                 }
00613 
00614                 wsize = pwrite(dst_fd, buf, rsize, offset);
00615                 if (wsize < 0) {
00616                         rc = -errno;
00617                         CT_ERROR(rc, "cannot write to '%s'", dst);
00618                         break;
00619                 }
00620 
00621                 write_total += wsize;
00622                 offset += wsize;
00623 
00624                 now = time(NULL);
00625                 /* sleep if needed, to honor bandwidth limits */
00626                 if (opt.o_bandwidth != 0) {
00627                         unsigned long long write_theory;
00628 
00629                         write_theory = (now - start_time) * opt.o_bandwidth;
00630 
00631                         if (write_theory < write_total) {
00632                                 unsigned long long      excess;
00633                                 struct timespec         delay;
00634 
00635                                 excess = write_total - write_theory;
00636 
00637                                 delay.tv_sec = excess / opt.o_bandwidth;
00638                                 delay.tv_nsec = (excess % opt.o_bandwidth) *
00639                                         NSEC_PER_SEC / opt.o_bandwidth;
00640 
00641                                 if (now >= last_bw_print + opt.o_report_int) {
00642                                         CT_TRACE("bandwith control: %lluB/s "
00643                                                  "excess=%llu sleep for "
00644                                                  "%lld.%09lds",
00645                                                  opt.o_bandwidth, excess,
00646                                                  (long long)delay.tv_sec,
00647                                                  delay.tv_nsec);
00648                                         last_bw_print = now;
00649                                 }
00650 
00651                                 do {
00652                                         rc = nanosleep(&delay, &delay);
00653                                 } while (rc < 0 && errno == EINTR);
00654                                 if (rc < 0) {
00655                                         CT_ERROR(errno, "delay for bandwidth "
00656                                                  "control failed to sleep: "
00657                                                  "residual=%lld.%09lds",
00658                                                  (long long)delay.tv_sec,
00659                                                  delay.tv_nsec);
00660                                         rc = 0;
00661                                 }
00662                         }
00663                 }
00664 
00665                 now = time(NULL);
00666                 if (now >= last_report_time + opt.o_report_int) {
00667                         last_report_time = now;
00668                         CT_TRACE("%%%ju ", (uintmax_t)(100 * write_total / length));
00669                         /* only give the length of the write since the last
00670                          * progress report */
00671                         he.length = offset - he.offset;
00672                         rc = llapi_hsm_action_progress(hcp, &he, length, 0);
00673                         if (rc < 0) {
00674                                 /* Action has been canceled or something wrong
00675                                  * is happening. Stop copying data. */
00676                                 CT_ERROR(rc, "progress ioctl for copy"
00677                                          " '%s'->'%s' failed", src, dst);
00678                                 goto out;
00679                         }
00680                         he.offset = offset;
00681                 }
00682                 rc = 0;
00683         }
00684 
00685 out:
00686         /*
00687          * truncate restored file
00688          * size is taken from the archive this is done to support
00689          * restore after a force release which leaves the file with the
00690          * wrong size (can big bigger than the new size)
00691          */
00692         if ((hai->hai_action == HSMA_RESTORE) &&
00693             (src_st.st_size < dst_st.st_size)) {
00694                 /*
00695                  * make sure the file is on disk before reporting success.
00696                  */
00697                 rc = ftruncate(dst_fd, src_st.st_size);
00698                 if (rc < 0) {
00699                         rc = -errno;
00700                         CT_ERROR(rc, "cannot truncate '%s' to size %jd",
00701                                  dst, (intmax_t)src_st.st_size);
00702                         err_major++;
00703                 }
00704         }
00705 
00706         if (buf != NULL)
00707                 free(buf);
00708 
00709         CT_TRACE("copied %ju bytes in %f seconds",
00710                  (uintmax_t)length, ct_now() - start_ct_now);
00711 
00712         return rc;
00713 }
00714 
00715 /* Copy file attributes from file src to file dest */
00716 static int ct_copy_attr(const char *src, const char *dst, int src_fd,
00717                         int dst_fd)
00718 {
00719         struct stat     st;
00720         struct timeval  times[2];
00721         int             rc;
00722 
00723         if (fstat(src_fd, &st) < 0) {
00724                 rc = -errno;
00725                 CT_ERROR(rc, "cannot stat '%s'", src);
00726                 return rc;
00727         }
00728 
00729         times[0].tv_sec = st.st_atime;
00730         times[0].tv_usec = 0;
00731         times[1].tv_sec = st.st_mtime;
00732         times[1].tv_usec = 0;
00733         if (fchmod(dst_fd, st.st_mode) < 0 ||
00734             fchown(dst_fd, st.st_uid, st.st_gid) < 0 ||
00735             futimes(dst_fd, times) < 0) {
00736                 rc = -errno;
00737                 CT_ERROR(rc, "cannot set attributes of '%s'", src);
00738                 return rc;
00739         }
00740 
00741         return 0;
00742 }
00743 
00744 static int ct_copy_xattr(const char *src, const char *dst, int src_fd,
00745                          int dst_fd, bool is_restore)
00746 {
00747         char     list[XATTR_LIST_MAX];
00748         char     value[XATTR_SIZE_MAX];
00749         char    *name;
00750         ssize_t  list_len;
00751         int      rc;
00752 
00753         list_len = flistxattr(src_fd, list, sizeof(list));
00754         if (list_len < 0)
00755                 return -errno;
00756 
00757         name = list;
00758         while (name < list + list_len) {
00759                 rc = fgetxattr(src_fd, name, value, sizeof(value));
00760                 if (rc < 0)
00761                         return -errno;
00762 
00763                 /* when we restore, we do not restore lustre xattr */
00764                 if (!is_restore ||
00765                     (strncmp(XATTR_TRUSTED_PREFIX, name,
00766                              sizeof(XATTR_TRUSTED_PREFIX) - 1) != 0)) {
00767                         rc = fsetxattr(dst_fd, name, value, rc, 0);
00768                         CT_TRACE("fsetxattr of '%s' on '%s' rc=%d (%s)",
00769                                  name, dst, rc, strerror(errno));
00770                         /* lustre.* attrs aren't supported on other FS's */
00771                         if (rc < 0 && errno != EOPNOTSUPP) {
00772                                 rc = -errno;
00773                                 CT_ERROR(rc, "cannot set extended attribute"
00774                                          " '%s' of '%s'",
00775                                          name, dst);
00776                                 return rc;
00777                         }
00778                 }
00779                 name += strlen(name) + 1;
00780         }
00781 
00782         return 0;
00783 }
00784 
00785 static int ct_path_lustre(char *buf, int sz, const char *mnt,
00786                           const lustre_fid *fid)
00787 {
00788         return snprintf(buf, sz, "%s/%s/fid/"DFID_NOBRACE, mnt,
00789                         dot_lustre_name, PFID(fid));
00790 }
00791 
00792 static int ct_path_archive(char *buf, int sz, const char *archive_dir,
00793                            const lustre_fid *fid)
00794 {
00795         return snprintf(buf, sz, "%s/%04x/%04x/%04x/%04x/%04x/%04x/"
00796                         DFID_NOBRACE, archive_dir,
00797                         (fid)->f_oid       & 0xFFFF,
00798                         (fid)->f_oid >> 16 & 0xFFFF,
00799                         (unsigned int)((fid)->f_seq       & 0xFFFF),
00800                         (unsigned int)((fid)->f_seq >> 16 & 0xFFFF),
00801                         (unsigned int)((fid)->f_seq >> 32 & 0xFFFF),
00802                         (unsigned int)((fid)->f_seq >> 48 & 0xFFFF),
00803                         PFID(fid));
00804 }
00805 
00806 static bool ct_is_retryable(int err)
00807 {
00808         return err == -ETIMEDOUT;
00809 }
00810 
00811 static int ct_begin_restore(struct hsm_copyaction_private **phcp,
00812                             const struct hsm_action_item *hai,
00813                             int mdt_index, int open_flags)
00814 {
00815         char     src[PATH_MAX];
00816         int      rc;
00817 
00818         rc = llapi_hsm_action_begin(phcp, ctdata, hai, mdt_index, open_flags,
00819                                     false);
00820         if (rc < 0) {
00821                 ct_path_lustre(src, sizeof(src), opt.o_mnt, &hai->hai_fid);
00822                 CT_ERROR(rc, "llapi_hsm_action_begin() on '%s' failed", src);
00823         }
00824 
00825         return rc;
00826 }
00827 
00828 static int ct_begin(struct hsm_copyaction_private **phcp,
00829                     const struct hsm_action_item *hai)
00830 {
00831         /* Restore takes specific parameters. Call the same function w/ default
00832          * values for all other operations. */
00833         return ct_begin_restore(phcp, hai, -1, 0);
00834 }
00835 
00836 static int ct_fini(struct hsm_copyaction_private **phcp,
00837                    const struct hsm_action_item *hai, int hp_flags, int ct_rc)
00838 {
00839         struct hsm_copyaction_private   *hcp;
00840         char                             lstr[PATH_MAX];
00841         int                              rc;
00842 
00843         CT_TRACE("Action completed, notifying coordinator "
00844                  "cookie=%#jx, FID="DFID", hp_flags=%d err=%d",
00845                  (uintmax_t)hai->hai_cookie, PFID(&hai->hai_fid),
00846                  hp_flags, -ct_rc);
00847 
00848         ct_path_lustre(lstr, sizeof(lstr), opt.o_mnt, &hai->hai_fid);
00849 
00850         if (phcp == NULL || *phcp == NULL) {
00851                 rc = llapi_hsm_action_begin(&hcp, ctdata, hai, -1, 0, true);
00852                 if (rc < 0) {
00853                         CT_ERROR(rc, "llapi_hsm_action_begin() on '%s' failed",
00854                                  lstr);
00855                         return rc;
00856                 }
00857                 phcp = &hcp;
00858         }
00859 
00860         rc = llapi_hsm_action_end(phcp, &hai->hai_extent, hp_flags, abs(ct_rc));
00861         if (rc == -ECANCELED)
00862                 CT_ERROR(rc, "completed action on '%s' has been canceled: "
00863                          "cookie=%#jx, FID="DFID, lstr,
00864                          (uintmax_t)hai->hai_cookie, PFID(&hai->hai_fid));
00865         else if (rc < 0)
00866                 CT_ERROR(rc, "llapi_hsm_action_end() on '%s' failed", lstr);
00867         else
00868                 CT_TRACE("llapi_hsm_action_end() on '%s' ok (rc=%d)",
00869                          lstr, rc);
00870 
00871         return rc;
00872 }
00873 
00874 static int ct_archive(const struct hsm_action_item *hai, const long hal_flags)
00875 {
00876         struct hsm_copyaction_private   *hcp = NULL;
00877         char                             src[PATH_MAX];
00878         char                             dst[PATH_MAX] = "";
00879         int                              rc;
00880         int                              rcf = 0;
00881         bool                             rename_needed = false;
00882         int                              hp_flags = 0;
00883         int                              open_flags;
00884         int                              src_fd = -1;
00885         int                              dst_fd = -1;
00886 
00887         rc = ct_begin(&hcp, hai);
00888         if (rc < 0)
00889                 goto fini_major;
00890 
00891         /* we fill archive so:
00892          * source = data FID
00893          * destination = lustre FID
00894          */
00895         ct_path_lustre(src, sizeof(src), opt.o_mnt, &hai->hai_dfid);
00896         ct_path_archive(dst, sizeof(dst), opt.o_hsm_root, &hai->hai_fid);
00897         if (hai->hai_extent.length == -1) {
00898                 /* whole file, write it to tmp location and atomically
00899                  * replace old archived file */
00900                 strlcat(dst, "_tmp", sizeof(dst));
00901                 /* we cannot rely on the same test because ct_copy_data()
00902                  * updates hai_extent.length */
00903                 rename_needed = true;
00904         }
00905 
00906         CT_TRACE("archiving '%s' to '%s'", src, dst);
00907 
00908         if (opt.o_dry_run) {
00909                 rc = 0;
00910                 goto fini_major;
00911         }
00912 
00913         rc = ct_mkdir_p(dst);
00914         if (rc < 0) {
00915                 CT_ERROR(rc, "mkdir_p '%s' failed", dst);
00916                 goto fini_major;
00917         }
00918 
00919         src_fd = llapi_hsm_action_get_fd(hcp);
00920         if (src_fd < 0) {
00921                 rc = src_fd;
00922                 CT_ERROR(rc, "cannot open '%s' for read", src);
00923                 goto fini_major;
00924         }
00925 
00926         open_flags = O_WRONLY | O_NOFOLLOW;
00927         /* If extent is specified, don't truncate an old archived copy */
00928         open_flags |= ((hai->hai_extent.length == -1) ? O_TRUNC : 0) | O_CREAT;
00929 
00930         dst_fd = open(dst, open_flags, FILE_PERM);
00931         if (dst_fd == -1) {
00932                 rc = -errno;
00933                 CT_ERROR(rc, "cannot open '%s' for write", dst);
00934                 goto fini_major;
00935         }
00936 
00937         /* saving stripe is not critical */
00938         rc = ct_save_stripe(src_fd, src, dst);
00939         if (rc < 0)
00940                 CT_ERROR(rc, "cannot save file striping info of '%s' in '%s'",
00941                          src, dst);
00942 
00943         rc = ct_copy_data(hcp, src, dst, src_fd, dst_fd, hai, hal_flags);
00944         if (rc < 0) {
00945                 CT_ERROR(rc, "data copy failed from '%s' to '%s'", src, dst);
00946                 goto fini_major;
00947         }
00948 
00949         rc = fsync(dst_fd);
00950         if (rc < 0) {
00951                 rc = -errno;
00952                 CT_ERROR(rc, "cannot flush '%s' archive file '%s'", src, dst);
00953                 goto fini_major;
00954         }
00955 
00956         CT_TRACE("data archiving for '%s' to '%s' done", src, dst);
00957 
00958         /* attrs will remain on the MDS; no need to copy them, except possibly
00959           for disaster recovery */
00960         if (opt.o_copy_attrs) {
00961                 rc = ct_copy_attr(src, dst, src_fd, dst_fd);
00962                 if (rc < 0) {
00963                         CT_ERROR(rc, "cannot copy attr of '%s' to '%s'",
00964                                  src, dst);
00965                         rcf = rc;
00966                 }
00967                 CT_TRACE("attr file for '%s' saved to archive '%s'",
00968                          src, dst);
00969         }
00970 
00971         /* xattrs will remain on the MDS; no need to copy them, except possibly
00972          for disaster recovery */
00973         if (opt.o_copy_xattrs) {
00974                 rc = ct_copy_xattr(src, dst, src_fd, dst_fd, false);
00975                 if (rc < 0) {
00976                         CT_ERROR(rc, "cannot copy xattr of '%s' to '%s'",
00977                                  src, dst);
00978                         rcf = rcf ? rcf : rc;
00979                 }
00980                 CT_TRACE("xattr file for '%s' saved to archive '%s'",
00981                          src, dst);
00982         }
00983 
00984         if (rename_needed == true) {
00985                 char     tmp_src[PATH_MAX];
00986                 char     tmp_dst[PATH_MAX];
00987 
00988                 /* atomically replace old archived file */
00989                 ct_path_archive(src, sizeof(src), opt.o_hsm_root,
00990                                 &hai->hai_fid);
00991                 rc = rename(dst, src);
00992                 if (rc < 0) {
00993                         rc = -errno;
00994                         CT_ERROR(rc, "cannot rename '%s' to '%s'", dst, src);
00995                         goto fini_major;
00996                 }
00997                 /* rename lov file */
00998                 snprintf(tmp_src, sizeof(tmp_src), "%s.lov", src);
00999                 snprintf(tmp_dst, sizeof(tmp_dst), "%s.lov", dst);
01000                 rc = rename(tmp_dst, tmp_src);
01001                 if (rc < 0)
01002                         CT_ERROR(errno, "cannot rename '%s' to '%s'",
01003                                  tmp_dst, tmp_src);
01004         }
01005 
01006         if (opt.o_shadow_tree) {
01007                 /* Create a namespace of softlinks that shadows the original
01008                  * Lustre namespace.  This will only be current at
01009                  * time-of-archive (won't follow renames).
01010                  * WARNING: release won't kill these links; a manual
01011                  * cleanup of dead links would be required.
01012                  */
01013                 char             buf[PATH_MAX];
01014                 long long        recno = -1;
01015                 int              linkno = 0;
01016                 char            *ptr;
01017                 int              depth = 0;
01018                 ssize_t          sz;
01019 
01020                 sprintf(buf, DFID, PFID(&hai->hai_fid));
01021                 sprintf(src, "%s/shadow/", opt.o_hsm_root);
01022 
01023                 ptr = opt.o_hsm_root;
01024                 while (*ptr)
01025                         (*ptr++ == '/') ? depth-- : 0;
01026 
01027                 rc = llapi_fid2path(opt.o_mnt, buf, src + strlen(src),
01028                                     sizeof(src) - strlen(src), &recno, &linkno);
01029                 if (rc < 0) {
01030                         CT_ERROR(rc, "cannot get FID of '%s'", buf);
01031                         rcf = rcf ? rcf : rc;
01032                         goto fini_minor;
01033                 }
01034 
01035                 /* Figure out how many parent dirs to symlink back */
01036                 ptr = src;
01037                 while (*ptr)
01038                         (*ptr++ == '/') ? depth++ : 0;
01039                 sprintf(buf, "..");
01040                 while (--depth > 1)
01041                         strcat(buf, "/..");
01042 
01043                 ct_path_archive(dst, sizeof(dst), buf, &hai->hai_fid);
01044 
01045                 if (ct_mkdir_p(src)) {
01046                         CT_ERROR(errno, "mkdir_p '%s' failed", src);
01047                         rcf = rcf ? rcf : -errno;
01048                         goto fini_minor;
01049                 }
01050                 /* symlink already exists ? */
01051                 sz = readlink(src, buf, sizeof(buf));
01052                 /* detect truncation */
01053                 if (sz == sizeof(buf)) {
01054                         rcf = rcf ? rcf : -E2BIG;
01055                         CT_ERROR(rcf, "readlink '%s' truncated", src);
01056                         goto fini_minor;
01057                 }
01058                 if (sz >= 0) {
01059                         buf[sz] = '\0';
01060                         if (sz == 0 || strncmp(buf, dst, sz) != 0) {
01061                                 if (unlink(src) && errno != ENOENT) {
01062                                         CT_ERROR(errno,
01063                                                  "cannot unlink symlink '%s'",
01064                                                  src);
01065                                         rcf = rcf ? rcf : -errno;
01066                                         goto fini_minor;
01067                                 /* unlink old symlink done */
01068                                 CT_TRACE("remove old symlink '%s' pointing"
01069                                          " to '%s'", src, buf);
01070                                 }
01071                         } else {
01072                                 /* symlink already ok */
01073                                 CT_TRACE("symlink '%s' already pointing"
01074                                          " to '%s'", src, dst);
01075                                 rcf = 0;
01076                                 goto fini_minor;
01077                         }
01078                 }
01079                 if (symlink(dst, src)) {
01080                         CT_ERROR(errno, "cannot symlink '%s' to '%s'",
01081                                  src, dst);
01082                         rcf = rcf ? rcf : -errno;
01083                         goto fini_minor;
01084                 }
01085                 CT_TRACE("symlink '%s' to '%s' done", src, dst);
01086         }
01087 fini_minor:
01088         if (rcf)
01089                 err_minor++;
01090         goto out;
01091 
01092 
01093 fini_major:
01094         err_major++;
01095 
01096         unlink(dst);
01097         if (ct_is_retryable(rc))
01098                 hp_flags |= HP_FLAG_RETRY;
01099 
01100         rcf = rc;
01101 
01102 out:
01103         if (!(src_fd < 0))
01104                 close(src_fd);
01105 
01106         if (!(dst_fd < 0))
01107                 close(dst_fd);
01108 
01109         rc = ct_fini(&hcp, hai, hp_flags, rcf);
01110 
01111         return rc;
01112 }
01113 
01114 static int ct_restore(const struct hsm_action_item *hai, const long hal_flags)
01115 {
01116         struct hsm_copyaction_private   *hcp = NULL;
01117         char                             src[PATH_MAX];
01118         char                             dst[PATH_MAX];
01119         char                             lov_buf[XATTR_SIZE_MAX];
01120         size_t                           lov_size = sizeof(lov_buf);
01121         int                              rc;
01122         int                              hp_flags = 0;
01123         int                              src_fd = -1;
01124         int                              dst_fd = -1;
01125         int                              mdt_index = -1;
01126         int                              open_flags = 0;
01127         bool                             set_lovea;
01128         struct lu_fid                    dfid;
01129         /* we fill lustre so:
01130          * source = lustre FID in the backend
01131          * destination = data FID = volatile file
01132          */
01133 
01134         /* build backend file name from released file FID */
01135         ct_path_archive(src, sizeof(src), opt.o_hsm_root, &hai->hai_fid);
01136 
01137         rc = llapi_get_mdt_index_by_fid(opt.o_mnt_fd, &hai->hai_fid,
01138                                         &mdt_index);
01139         if (rc < 0) {
01140                 CT_ERROR(rc, "cannot get mdt index "DFID"",
01141                          PFID(&hai->hai_fid));
01142                 return rc;
01143         }
01144         /* restore loads and sets the LOVEA w/o interpreting it to avoid
01145          * dependency on the structure format. */
01146         rc = ct_load_stripe(src, lov_buf, &lov_size);
01147         if (rc < 0) {
01148                 CT_WARN("cannot get stripe rules for '%s' (%s), use default",
01149                         src, strerror(-rc));
01150                 set_lovea = false;
01151         } else {
01152                 open_flags |= O_LOV_DELAY_CREATE;
01153                 set_lovea = true;
01154         }
01155 
01156         rc = ct_begin_restore(&hcp, hai, mdt_index, open_flags);
01157         if (rc < 0)
01158                 goto fini;
01159 
01160         /* get the FID of the volatile file */
01161         rc = llapi_hsm_action_get_dfid(hcp, &dfid);
01162         if (rc < 0) {
01163                 CT_ERROR(rc, "restoring "DFID
01164                          ", cannot get FID of created volatile file",
01165                          PFID(&hai->hai_fid));
01166                 goto fini;
01167         }
01168 
01169         /* build volatile "file name", for messages */
01170         snprintf(dst, sizeof(dst), "{VOLATILE}="DFID, PFID(&dfid));
01171 
01172         CT_TRACE("restoring data from '%s' to '%s'", src, dst);
01173 
01174         if (opt.o_dry_run) {
01175                 rc = 0;
01176                 goto fini;
01177         }
01178 
01179         src_fd = open(src, O_RDONLY | O_NOATIME | O_NOFOLLOW);
01180         if (src_fd < 0) {
01181                 rc = -errno;
01182                 CT_ERROR(rc, "cannot open '%s' for read", src);
01183                 goto fini;
01184         }
01185 
01186         dst_fd = llapi_hsm_action_get_fd(hcp);
01187         if (dst_fd < 0) {
01188                 rc = dst_fd;
01189                 CT_ERROR(rc, "cannot open '%s' for write", dst);
01190                 goto fini;
01191         }
01192 
01193         if (set_lovea) {
01194                 /* the layout cannot be allocated through .fid so we have to
01195                  * restore a layout */
01196                 rc = ct_restore_stripe(src, dst, dst_fd, lov_buf, lov_size);
01197                 if (rc < 0) {
01198                         CT_ERROR(rc, "cannot restore file striping info"
01199                                  " for '%s' from '%s'", dst, src);
01200                         err_major++;
01201                         goto fini;
01202                 }
01203         }
01204 
01205         rc = ct_copy_data(hcp, src, dst, src_fd, dst_fd, hai, hal_flags);
01206         if (rc < 0) {
01207                 CT_ERROR(rc, "cannot copy data from '%s' to '%s'",
01208                          src, dst);
01209                 err_major++;
01210                 if (ct_is_retryable(rc))
01211                         hp_flags |= HP_FLAG_RETRY;
01212                 goto fini;
01213         }
01214 
01215         CT_TRACE("data restore from '%s' to '%s' done", src, dst);
01216 
01217 fini:
01218         rc = ct_fini(&hcp, hai, hp_flags, rc);
01219 
01220         /* object swaping is done by cdt at copy end, so close of volatile file
01221          * cannot be done before */
01222         if (!(src_fd < 0))
01223                 close(src_fd);
01224 
01225         if (!(dst_fd < 0))
01226                 close(dst_fd);
01227 
01228         return rc;
01229 }
01230 
01231 static int ct_remove(const struct hsm_action_item *hai, const long hal_flags)
01232 {
01233         struct hsm_copyaction_private   *hcp = NULL;
01234         char                             dst[PATH_MAX];
01235         int                              rc;
01236 
01237         rc = ct_begin(&hcp, hai);
01238         if (rc < 0)
01239                 goto fini;
01240 
01241         ct_path_archive(dst, sizeof(dst), opt.o_hsm_root, &hai->hai_fid);
01242 
01243         CT_TRACE("removing file '%s'", dst);
01244 
01245         if (opt.o_dry_run) {
01246                 rc = 0;
01247                 goto fini;
01248         }
01249 
01250         rc = unlink(dst);
01251         if (rc < 0) {
01252                 rc = -errno;
01253                 CT_ERROR(rc, "cannot unlink '%s'", dst);
01254                 err_minor++;
01255                 goto fini;
01256         }
01257 
01258         strlcat(dst, ".lov", sizeof(dst));
01259         rc = unlink(dst);
01260         if (rc < 0) {
01261                 rc = -errno;
01262                 CT_ERROR(rc, "cannot unlink '%s'", dst);
01263                 err_minor++;
01264                 goto fini;
01265         }
01266 
01267 fini:
01268         rc = ct_fini(&hcp, hai, 0, rc);
01269 
01270         return rc;
01271 }
01272 
01273 static int ct_process_item(struct hsm_action_item *hai, const long hal_flags)
01274 {
01275         int     rc = 0;
01276 
01277         if (opt.o_verbose >= LLAPI_MSG_INFO || opt.o_dry_run) {
01278                 /* Print the original path */
01279                 char            fid[128];
01280                 char            path[PATH_MAX];
01281                 long long       recno = -1;
01282                 int             linkno = 0;
01283 
01284                 sprintf(fid, DFID, PFID(&hai->hai_fid));
01285                 CT_TRACE("'%s' action %s reclen %d, cookie=%#jx",
01286                          fid, hsm_copytool_action2name(hai->hai_action),
01287                          hai->hai_len, (uintmax_t)hai->hai_cookie);
01288                 rc = llapi_fid2path(opt.o_mnt, fid, path,
01289                                     sizeof(path), &recno, &linkno);
01290                 if (rc < 0)
01291                         CT_ERROR(rc, "cannot get path of FID %s", fid);
01292                 else
01293                         CT_TRACE("processing file '%s'", path);
01294         }
01295 
01296         switch (hai->hai_action) {
01297         /* set err_major, minor inside these functions */
01298         case HSMA_ARCHIVE:
01299                 rc = ct_archive(hai, hal_flags);
01300                 break;
01301         case HSMA_RESTORE:
01302                 rc = ct_restore(hai, hal_flags);
01303                 break;
01304         case HSMA_REMOVE:
01305                 rc = ct_remove(hai, hal_flags);
01306                 break;
01307         case HSMA_CANCEL:
01308                 CT_TRACE("cancel not implemented for file system '%s'",
01309                          opt.o_mnt);
01310                 /* Don't report progress to coordinator for this cookie:
01311                  * the copy function will get ECANCELED when reporting
01312                  * progress. */
01313                 err_minor++;
01314                 return 0;
01315                 break;
01316         default:
01317                 rc = -EINVAL;
01318                 CT_ERROR(rc, "unknown action %d, on '%s'", hai->hai_action,
01319                          opt.o_mnt);
01320                 err_minor++;
01321                 ct_fini(NULL, hai, 0, rc);
01322         }
01323 
01324         return 0;
01325 }
01326 
01327 struct ct_th_data {
01328         long                     hal_flags;
01329         struct hsm_action_item  *hai;
01330 };
01331 
01332 static void *ct_thread(void *data)
01333 {
01334         struct ct_th_data *cttd = data;
01335         int rc;
01336 
01337         rc = ct_process_item(cttd->hai, cttd->hal_flags);
01338 
01339         free(cttd->hai);
01340         free(cttd);
01341         pthread_exit((void *)(intptr_t)rc);
01342 }
01343 
01344 static int ct_process_item_async(const struct hsm_action_item *hai,
01345                                  long hal_flags)
01346 {
01347         pthread_attr_t           attr;
01348         pthread_t                thread;
01349         struct ct_th_data       *data;
01350         int                      rc;
01351 
01352         data = malloc(sizeof(*data));
01353         if (data == NULL)
01354                 return -ENOMEM;
01355 
01356         data->hai = malloc(hai->hai_len);
01357         if (data->hai == NULL) {
01358                 free(data);
01359                 return -ENOMEM;
01360         }
01361 
01362         memcpy(data->hai, hai, hai->hai_len);
01363         data->hal_flags = hal_flags;
01364 
01365         rc = pthread_attr_init(&attr);
01366         if (rc != 0) {
01367                 CT_ERROR(rc, "pthread_attr_init failed for '%s' service",
01368                          opt.o_mnt);
01369                 free(data->hai);
01370                 free(data);
01371                 return -rc;
01372         }
01373 
01374         pthread_attr_setdetachstate(&attr, PTHREAD_CREATE_DETACHED);
01375 
01376         rc = pthread_create(&thread, &attr, ct_thread, data);
01377         if (rc != 0)
01378                 CT_ERROR(rc, "cannot create thread for '%s' service",
01379                          opt.o_mnt);
01380 
01381         pthread_attr_destroy(&attr);
01382         return 0;
01383 }
01384 
01385 static int ct_import_one(const char *src, const char *dst)
01386 {
01387         char            newarc[PATH_MAX];
01388         lustre_fid      fid;
01389         struct stat     st;
01390         int             rc;
01391 
01392         CT_TRACE("importing '%s' from '%s'", dst, src);
01393 
01394         if (stat(src, &st) < 0) {
01395                 rc = -errno;
01396                 CT_ERROR(rc, "cannot stat '%s'", src);
01397                 return rc;
01398         }
01399 
01400         if (opt.o_dry_run)
01401                 return 0;
01402 
01403         rc = llapi_hsm_import(dst,
01404                               opt.o_archive_cnt ? opt.o_archive_id[0] : 0,
01405                               &st, 0, 0, 0, 0, NULL, &fid);
01406         if (rc < 0) {
01407                 CT_ERROR(rc, "cannot import '%s' from '%s'", dst, src);
01408                 return rc;
01409         }
01410 
01411         ct_path_archive(newarc, sizeof(newarc), opt.o_hsm_root, &fid);
01412 
01413         rc = ct_mkdir_p(newarc);
01414         if (rc < 0) {
01415                 CT_ERROR(rc, "mkdir_p '%s' failed", newarc);
01416                 err_major++;
01417                 return rc;
01418 
01419         }
01420 
01421         /* Lots of choices now: mv, ln, ln -s ? */
01422         rc = link(src, newarc); /* hardlink */
01423         if (rc < 0) {
01424                 rc = -errno;
01425                 CT_ERROR(rc, "cannot link '%s' to '%s'", newarc, src);
01426                 err_major++;
01427                 return rc;
01428         }
01429         CT_TRACE("imported '%s' from '%s'=='%s'", dst, newarc, src);
01430 
01431         return 0;
01432 }
01433 
01434 static char *path_concat(const char *dirname, const char *basename)
01435 {
01436         char    *result;
01437         int      rc;
01438 
01439         rc = asprintf(&result, "%s/%s", dirname, basename);
01440         if (rc < 0)
01441                 return NULL;
01442 
01443         return result;
01444 }
01445 
01446 static int ct_import_fid(const lustre_fid *import_fid)
01447 {
01448         char    fid_path[PATH_MAX];
01449         int     rc;
01450 
01451         ct_path_lustre(fid_path, sizeof(fid_path), opt.o_mnt, import_fid);
01452         rc = access(fid_path, F_OK);
01453         if (rc == 0 || errno != ENOENT) {
01454                 rc = (errno == 0) ? -EEXIST : -errno;
01455                 CT_ERROR(rc, "cannot import '"DFID"'", PFID(import_fid));
01456                 return rc;
01457         }
01458 
01459         ct_path_archive(fid_path, sizeof(fid_path), opt.o_hsm_root,
01460                         import_fid);
01461 
01462         CT_TRACE("Resolving "DFID" to %s", PFID(import_fid), fid_path);
01463 
01464         return ct_import_one(fid_path, opt.o_dst);
01465 }
01466 
01467 static int ct_import_recurse(const char *relpath)
01468 {
01469         DIR             *dir;
01470         struct dirent    ent, *cookie = NULL;
01471         char            *srcpath, *newpath;
01472         lustre_fid       import_fid;
01473         int              rc;
01474 
01475         if (relpath == NULL)
01476                 return -EINVAL;
01477 
01478         /* Is relpath a FID? In which case SFID should expand to three
01479          * elements. */
01480         rc = sscanf(relpath, SFID, RFID(&import_fid));
01481         if (rc == 3)
01482                 return ct_import_fid(&import_fid);
01483 
01484         srcpath = path_concat(opt.o_hsm_root, relpath);
01485         if (srcpath == NULL) {
01486                 err_major++;
01487                 return -ENOMEM;
01488         }
01489 
01490         dir = opendir(srcpath);
01491         if (dir == NULL) {
01492                 /* Not a dir, or error */
01493                 if (errno == ENOTDIR) {
01494                         /* Single regular file case, treat o_dst as absolute
01495                            final location. */
01496                         rc = ct_import_one(srcpath, opt.o_dst);
01497                 } else {
01498                         rc = -errno;
01499                         CT_ERROR(rc, "cannot opendir '%s'", srcpath);
01500                         err_major++;
01501                 }
01502                 free(srcpath);
01503                 return rc;
01504         }
01505         free(srcpath);
01506 
01507         while (1) {
01508                 rc = readdir_r(dir, &ent, &cookie);
01509                 if (rc != 0) {
01510                         rc = -errno;
01511                         CT_ERROR(rc, "cannot readdir_r '%s'", relpath);
01512                         err_major++;
01513                         goto out;
01514                 } else if ((rc == 0) && (cookie == NULL)) {
01515                         /* end of directory */
01516                         break;
01517                 }
01518 
01519                 if (!strcmp(ent.d_name, ".") ||
01520                     !strcmp(ent.d_name, ".."))
01521                         continue;
01522 
01523                 /* New relative path */
01524                 newpath = path_concat(relpath, ent.d_name);
01525                 if (newpath == NULL) {
01526                         err_major++;
01527                         rc = -ENOMEM;
01528                         goto out;
01529                 }
01530 
01531                 if (ent.d_type == DT_DIR) {
01532                         rc = ct_import_recurse(newpath);
01533                 } else {
01534                         char src[PATH_MAX];
01535                         char dst[PATH_MAX];
01536 
01537                         sprintf(src, "%s/%s", opt.o_hsm_root, newpath);
01538                         sprintf(dst, "%s/%s", opt.o_dst, newpath);
01539                         /* Make the target dir in the Lustre fs */
01540                         rc = ct_mkdir_p(dst);
01541                         if (rc == 0) {
01542                                 /* Import the file */
01543                                 rc = ct_import_one(src, dst);
01544                         } else {
01545                                 CT_ERROR(rc, "ct_mkdir_p '%s' failed", dst);
01546                                 err_major++;
01547                         }
01548                 }
01549 
01550                 if (rc != 0) {
01551                         CT_ERROR(rc, "cannot import '%s'", newpath);
01552                         if (err_major && opt.o_abort_on_error) {
01553                                 free(newpath);
01554                                 goto out;
01555                         }
01556                 }
01557                 free(newpath);
01558         }
01559 
01560         rc = 0;
01561 out:
01562         closedir(dir);
01563         return rc;
01564 }
01565 
01566 static int ct_rebind_one(const lustre_fid *old_fid, const lustre_fid *new_fid)
01567 {
01568         char    src[PATH_MAX];
01569         char    dst[PATH_MAX];
01570         int     rc;
01571 
01572         CT_TRACE("rebind "DFID" to "DFID, PFID(old_fid), PFID(new_fid));
01573 
01574         ct_path_archive(src, sizeof(src), opt.o_hsm_root, old_fid);
01575         ct_path_archive(dst, sizeof(dst), opt.o_hsm_root, new_fid);
01576 
01577         if (!opt.o_dry_run) {
01578                 ct_mkdir_p(dst);
01579                 if (rename(src, dst)) {
01580                         rc = -errno;
01581                         CT_ERROR(rc, "cannot rename '%s' to '%s'", src, dst);
01582                         return -errno;
01583                 }
01584                 /* rename lov file */
01585                 strlcat(src, ".lov", sizeof(src));
01586                 strlcat(dst, ".lov", sizeof(dst));
01587                 if (rename(src, dst))
01588                         CT_ERROR(errno, "cannot rename '%s' to '%s'", src, dst);
01589 
01590         }
01591         return 0;
01592 }
01593 
01594 static bool fid_is_file(lustre_fid *fid)
01595 {
01596         return fid_is_norm(fid) || fid_is_igif(fid);
01597 }
01598 
01599 static bool should_ignore_line(const char *line)
01600 {
01601         int     i;
01602 
01603         for (i = 0; line[i] != '\0'; i++) {
01604                 if (isspace(line[i]))
01605                         continue;
01606                 else if (line[i] == '#')
01607                         return true;
01608                 else
01609                         return false;
01610         }
01611 
01612         return true;
01613 }
01614 
01615 static int ct_rebind_list(const char *list)
01616 {
01617         int              rc;
01618         FILE            *filp;
01619         ssize_t          r;
01620         char            *line = NULL;
01621         size_t           line_size = 0;
01622         unsigned int     nl = 0;
01623         unsigned int     ok = 0;
01624 
01625         filp = fopen(list, "r");
01626         if (filp == NULL) {
01627                 rc = -errno;
01628                 CT_ERROR(rc, "cannot open '%s'", list);
01629                 return rc;
01630         }
01631 
01632         /* each line consists of 2 FID */
01633         while ((r = getline(&line, &line_size, filp)) != -1) {
01634                 lustre_fid      old_fid;
01635                 lustre_fid      new_fid;
01636 
01637                 /* Ignore empty and commented out ('#...') lines. */
01638                 if (should_ignore_line(line))
01639                         continue;
01640 
01641                 nl++;
01642 
01643                 rc = sscanf(line, SFID" "SFID, RFID(&old_fid), RFID(&new_fid));
01644                 if (rc != 6 || !fid_is_file(&old_fid) ||
01645                     !fid_is_file(&new_fid)) {
01646                         CT_ERROR(EINVAL,
01647                                  "'%s' FID expected near '%s', line %u",
01648                                  list, line, nl);
01649                         err_major++;
01650                         continue;
01651                 }
01652 
01653                 if (ct_rebind_one(&old_fid, &new_fid))
01654                         err_major++;
01655                 else
01656                         ok++;
01657         }
01658 
01659         fclose(filp);
01660 
01661         if (line)
01662                 free(line);
01663 
01664         /* return 0 if all rebinds were successful */
01665         CT_TRACE("%u lines read from '%s', %u rebind successful", nl, list, ok);
01666 
01667         return ok == nl ? 0 : -1;
01668 }
01669 
01670 static int ct_rebind(void)
01671 {
01672         int     rc;
01673 
01674         if (opt.o_dst) {
01675                 lustre_fid      old_fid;
01676                 lustre_fid      new_fid;
01677 
01678                 if (sscanf(opt.o_src, SFID, RFID(&old_fid)) != 3 ||
01679                     !fid_is_file(&old_fid)) {
01680                         rc = -EINVAL;
01681                         CT_ERROR(rc, "'%s' invalid FID format", opt.o_src);
01682                         return rc;
01683                 }
01684 
01685                 if (sscanf(opt.o_dst, SFID, RFID(&new_fid)) != 3 ||
01686                     !fid_is_file(&new_fid)) {
01687                         rc = -EINVAL;
01688                         CT_ERROR(rc, "'%s' invalid FID format", opt.o_dst);
01689                         return rc;
01690                 }
01691 
01692                 rc = ct_rebind_one(&old_fid, &new_fid);
01693 
01694                 return rc;
01695         }
01696 
01697         /* o_src is a list file */
01698         rc = ct_rebind_list(opt.o_src);
01699 
01700         return rc;
01701 }
01702 
01703 static int ct_dir_level_max(const char *dirpath, __u16 *sub_seqmax)
01704 {
01705         DIR             *dir;
01706         int              rc;
01707         __u16            sub_seq;
01708         struct dirent    ent, *cookie = NULL;
01709 
01710         *sub_seqmax = 0;
01711 
01712         dir = opendir(dirpath);
01713         if (dir == NULL) {
01714                 rc = -errno;
01715                 CT_ERROR(rc, "cannot open directory '%s'", opt.o_hsm_root);
01716                 return rc;
01717         }
01718 
01719         while ((rc = readdir_r(dir, &ent, &cookie)) == 0) {
01720                 if (cookie == NULL)
01721                         /* end of directory.
01722                          * rc is 0 and seqmax contains the max value. */
01723                         goto out;
01724 
01725                 if (!strcmp(ent.d_name, ".") || !strcmp(ent.d_name, ".."))
01726                         continue;
01727 
01728                 if (sscanf(ent.d_name, "%hx", &sub_seq) != 1) {
01729                         CT_TRACE("'%s' has an unexpected dirname format, "
01730                                  "skip entry", ent.d_name);
01731                         continue;
01732                 }
01733                 if (sub_seq > *sub_seqmax)
01734                         *sub_seqmax = sub_seq;
01735         }
01736         rc = -errno;
01737         CT_ERROR(rc, "cannot readdir_r '%s'", dirpath);
01738 
01739 out:
01740         closedir(dir);
01741         return rc;
01742 }
01743 
01744 static int ct_max_sequence(void)
01745 {
01746         int     rc, i;
01747         char    path[PATH_MAX];
01748         __u64   seq = 0;
01749         __u16   subseq;
01750 
01751         strlcpy(path, opt.o_hsm_root, sizeof(path));
01752         /* FID sequence is stored in top-level directory names:
01753          * hsm_root/16bits (high weight)/16 bits/16 bits/16 bits (low weight).
01754          */
01755         for (i = 0; i < 4; i++) {
01756                 size_t path_len;
01757 
01758                 rc = ct_dir_level_max(path, &subseq);
01759                 if (rc != 0)
01760                         return rc;
01761                 seq |= ((__u64)subseq << ((3 - i) * 16));
01762                 path_len = strlen(path);
01763                 rc = snprintf(path + path_len, sizeof(path) - path_len,
01764                               "/%04x", subseq);
01765                 if (rc >= (sizeof(path) - path_len))
01766                         return -E2BIG;
01767                 path[sizeof(path) - 1] = '\0';
01768         }
01769 
01770         printf("max_sequence: %#jx\n", (uintmax_t)seq);
01771 
01772         return 0;
01773 }
01774 
01775 static void handler(int signal)
01776 {
01777         psignal(signal, "exiting");
01778         /* If we don't clean up upon interrupt, umount thinks there's a ref
01779          * and doesn't remove us from mtab (EINPROGRESS). The lustre client
01780          * does successfully unmount and the mount is actually gone, but the
01781          * mtab entry remains. So this just makes mtab happier. */
01782         llapi_hsm_copytool_unregister(&ctdata);
01783 
01784         /* Also remove fifo upon signal as during normal/error exit */
01785         if (opt.o_event_fifo != NULL)
01786                 llapi_hsm_unregister_event_fifo(opt.o_event_fifo);
01787         _exit(1);
01788 }
01789 
01790 /* Daemon waits for messages from the kernel; run it in the background. */
01791 static int ct_run(void)
01792 {
01793         struct sigaction cleanup_sigaction;
01794         int rc;
01795 
01796         if (opt.o_daemonize) {
01797                 rc = daemon(1, 1);
01798                 if (rc < 0) {
01799                         rc = -errno;
01800                         CT_ERROR(rc, "cannot daemonize");
01801                         return rc;
01802                 }
01803         }
01804 
01805         setbuf(stdout, NULL);
01806 
01807         if (opt.o_event_fifo != NULL) {
01808                 rc = llapi_hsm_register_event_fifo(opt.o_event_fifo);
01809                 if (rc < 0) {
01810                         CT_ERROR(rc, "failed to register event fifo");
01811                         return rc;
01812                 }
01813                 llapi_error_callback_set(llapi_hsm_log_error);
01814         }
01815 
01816         rc = llapi_hsm_copytool_register(&ctdata, opt.o_mnt,
01817                                          opt.o_archive_cnt,
01818                                          opt.o_archive_id, 0);
01819         if (rc < 0) {
01820                 CT_ERROR(rc, "cannot start copytool interface");
01821                 return rc;
01822         }
01823 
01824         memset(&cleanup_sigaction, 0, sizeof(cleanup_sigaction));
01825         cleanup_sigaction.sa_handler = handler;
01826         sigemptyset(&cleanup_sigaction.sa_mask);
01827         sigaction(SIGINT, &cleanup_sigaction, NULL);
01828         sigaction(SIGTERM, &cleanup_sigaction, NULL);
01829 
01830         while (1) {
01831                 struct hsm_action_list *hal;
01832                 struct hsm_action_item *hai;
01833                 int msgsize;
01834                 int i = 0;
01835 
01836                 CT_TRACE("waiting for message from kernel");
01837 
01838                 rc = llapi_hsm_copytool_recv(ctdata, &hal, &msgsize);
01839                 if (rc == -ESHUTDOWN) {
01840                         CT_TRACE("shutting down");
01841                         break;
01842                 } else if (rc < 0) {
01843                         CT_WARN("cannot receive action list: %s",
01844                                 strerror(-rc));
01845                         err_major++;
01846                         if (opt.o_abort_on_error)
01847                                 break;
01848                         else
01849                                 continue;
01850                 }
01851 
01852                 CT_TRACE("copytool fs=%s archive#=%d item_count=%d",
01853                          hal->hal_fsname, hal->hal_archive_id, hal->hal_count);
01854 
01855                 if (strcmp(hal->hal_fsname, fs_name) != 0) {
01856                         rc = -EINVAL;
01857                         CT_ERROR(rc, "'%s' invalid fs name, expecting: %s",
01858                                  hal->hal_fsname, fs_name);
01859                         err_major++;
01860                         if (opt.o_abort_on_error)
01861                                 break;
01862                         else
01863                                 continue;
01864                 }
01865 
01866                 hai = hai_first(hal);
01867                 while (++i <= hal->hal_count) {
01868                         if ((char *)hai - (char *)hal > msgsize) {
01869                                 rc = -EPROTO;
01870                                 CT_ERROR(rc,
01871                                          "'%s' item %d past end of message!",
01872                                          opt.o_mnt, i);
01873                                 err_major++;
01874                                 break;
01875                         }
01876                         rc = ct_process_item_async(hai, hal->hal_flags);
01877                         if (rc < 0)
01878                                 CT_ERROR(rc, "'%s' item %d process",
01879                                          opt.o_mnt, i);
01880                         if (opt.o_abort_on_error && err_major)
01881                                 break;
01882                         hai = hai_next(hai);
01883                 }
01884 
01885                 if (opt.o_abort_on_error && err_major)
01886                         break;
01887         }
01888 
01889         llapi_hsm_copytool_unregister(&ctdata);
01890         if (opt.o_event_fifo != NULL)
01891                 llapi_hsm_unregister_event_fifo(opt.o_event_fifo);
01892 
01893         return rc;
01894 }
01895 
01896 static int ct_setup(void)
01897 {
01898         int     rc;
01899 
01900         /* set llapi message level */
01901         llapi_msg_set_level(opt.o_verbose);
01902 
01903         arc_fd = open(opt.o_hsm_root, O_RDONLY);
01904         if (arc_fd < 0) {
01905                 rc = -errno;
01906                 CT_ERROR(rc, "cannot open archive at '%s'", opt.o_hsm_root);
01907                 return rc;
01908         }
01909 
01910         rc = llapi_search_fsname(opt.o_mnt, fs_name);
01911         if (rc < 0) {
01912                 CT_ERROR(rc, "cannot find a Lustre filesystem mounted at '%s'",
01913                          opt.o_mnt);
01914                 return rc;
01915         }
01916 
01917         opt.o_mnt_fd = open(opt.o_mnt, O_RDONLY);
01918         if (opt.o_mnt_fd < 0) {
01919                 rc = -errno;
01920                 CT_ERROR(rc, "cannot open mount point at '%s'",
01921                          opt.o_mnt);
01922                 return rc;
01923         }
01924 
01925         return rc;
01926 }
01927 
01928 static int ct_cleanup(void)
01929 {
01930         int     rc;
01931 
01932         if (opt.o_mnt_fd >= 0) {
01933                 rc = close(opt.o_mnt_fd);
01934                 if (rc < 0) {
01935                         rc = -errno;
01936                         CT_ERROR(rc, "cannot close mount point");
01937                         return rc;
01938                 }
01939         }
01940 
01941         if (arc_fd >= 0) {
01942                 rc = close(arc_fd);
01943                 if (rc < 0) {
01944                         rc = -errno;
01945                         CT_ERROR(rc, "cannot close archive root directory");
01946                         return rc;
01947                 }
01948         }
01949 
01950         return 0;
01951 }
01952 
01953 int main(int argc, char **argv)
01954 {
01955         int     rc;
01956 
01957         strlcpy(cmd_name, basename(argv[0]), sizeof(cmd_name));
01958         rc = ct_parseopts(argc, argv);
01959         if (rc < 0) {
01960                 CT_WARN("try '%s --help' for more information", cmd_name);
01961                 return -rc;
01962         }
01963 
01964         rc = ct_setup();
01965         if (rc < 0)
01966                 goto error_cleanup;
01967 
01968         switch (opt.o_action) {
01969         case CA_IMPORT:
01970                 rc = ct_import_recurse(opt.o_src);
01971                 break;
01972         case CA_REBIND:
01973                 rc = ct_rebind();
01974                 break;
01975         case CA_MAXSEQ:
01976                 rc = ct_max_sequence();
01977                 break;
01978         default:
01979                 rc = ct_run();
01980                 break;
01981         }
01982 
01983         if (opt.o_action != CA_MAXSEQ)
01984                 CT_TRACE("process finished, errs: %d major, %d minor,"
01985                          " rc=%d (%s)", err_major, err_minor, rc,
01986                          strerror(-rc));
01987 
01988 error_cleanup:
01989         ct_cleanup();
01990 
01991         return -rc;
01992 }
